meanings.definition: To insert or fit into a slot.
meanings.sent1: She slotted the coin into the vending machine.
meanings.sent2: He slotted the key into the lock and turned it.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle piece was slotted perfectly into its place.
meanings.sent4: She slotted the final piece of the jigsaw puzzle with a satisfying click.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic expertly slotted the new part into the engine.

meanings.sent1: The slotted spoon had holes for draining liquids.
meanings.sent2: The slotted tray allowed excess water to drain away.
meanings.sent3: The slotted design of the drain cover prevented clogging.
meanings.sent4: The slotted metal grate let the sunlight filter through.
meanings.sent5: The slotted lid on the container allowed for ventilation.

meanings.definition: To schedule or designate a specific time or place for something.
meanings.sent1: She slotted the meeting for next Monday at 3 PM.
meanings.sent2: He slotted his dentist appointment in between classes.
meanings.sent3: The professor slotted the exam right before the holiday break.
meanings.sent4: She slotted the event into the calendar with a red marker.
meanings.sent5: The team captain slotted the practice session for early morning.
